text: my nearly two year old will suddenly decide the toy hes playing with is awful and get so angry with it. instead of going and playing with something else hell just keep throwing said toy whilst sobbing at it.
didnt want pasta even though its her favourite, threw it on the floor on the nice clean carpet and screamed as loud and as long as she could.
its just so hard work and i feel like i am just spending my life bribing her or asking her to do something else instead of what she wants to do just to distract her 247
my 2.5 year old gets agitated regularly and now he has dropped his nap (hes not really ready) he gets more tired and arsey  as the day goes on
this time ive found that ignoring works. i simply dont have the time to negotiate with them. i leave them on the floor to cry, letting them know they can come for a cuddle when theyre ready.

im at my wits end with dd (3). every morning on the school run she has a tantrum. it has been going on since september. we take her brother (6) to school. this morning she kicked off as soon as we left the house, refused to walk, refused to be picked up, hit me repeatedly when i tried to move her and in the end all i could do was push her (gently) with the palm of my hand to get her to the school gates.

yesterday, when he refused to move and lay down on pavement, i pretended to walk away as he always follows me (eventually) but i was aware it looked like he was on his own crying and felt uncomfortable with it as people were looking and may not have known i was nearby.
i carried her over my shoulder (or under my arm like a football, i cant remember) to her room, still screaming, and now kicking, too

so eventually ive had to give in because i get paranoid if the neighbours can hear him its 5am, i mean it was pure screaming to my own ears never mind anyone else. so i undo the gate tell him to head down il be there i was getting his little sister whos now screaming being woken up and yet hes screaming more at me.

my son threw the most ridiculous paddy in the gym car park today and was hell bent on throwing himself onto the very wet ground. i spent a good 30 seconds fighting him to keep him upright and ended up picking him up under one arm and marching him into the building.
getting him to do anything at all is such hard work, he whines, cries, shouts, says no, runs away, cries for daddy, wont share, pulls my hair and doesnt want to do anything other than play trains
i generally try to ignore the outburst, take away the things that he throws, and sit quietly near him, and be ready to hold him when he starts calming down a little bit
about five minutes after waking up (its the same whether i wake him or let him wake up by himself) he starts crying and screaming and nothing i do seems to make it any better.
my son has turned into another child in a matter of a few weeks and we are not sure if it is us, the situation, natural changes, or if there is anything we can do about it.
when he wakes up from a daytime nap hes often hysterical and inconsolable.
he will have a full blown rage at the smallest thing. yesterday he cried and screamed for nearly 20 minutes because i was speaking on the phone

he is so fussy if things dont go his way, to the point where it can become screaming. sharing with other kids is a big problems as well. anyone going through this stage i feel so tired sometimes. i try to keep calm always and let him know its okay to share, and he can play with other things etc, i acknowledge his feelings as well.

her rage is uncontrollable. she thrashes, kicks, bites her own hand or me, pulls her hair and face and throws herself around the floor banging her head on the floor. if i try to hold her it makes the rage worse and she hits and bites me. if i try to talk to her she screams no and the rage increases. sometimes its for 5 mins but yesterday one lasted for 25 mins and i had to ring my friend to collect my son from school as i was scared to leave the house
had a huge tantrum earlier because her grandad wouldnt pass her the salt pot off te table hmm.

she refuses to get out of her car seat. after much cajoling, negotiation and hell, even bribery, she was still refusing. i ended up lifting her out of the car and carrying her indoors screaming. that was 50 minutes ago and it continues. not just a whinge but full on, force ten screaming.  i am not sure where she gets the energy.
this means its very difficult to pick her up so i just sit on the ground trying my best to cradle her head in my lap while she freaks out so she doesnt hurt herself
he wouldnt talk, couldnt be distracted, didnt take the offered snack, wouldnt play with a toy, just screamed and screamed until he fell onto the floor and started pounding it.

oh god my toddler has nearly destroyed me today. for a large part of the day hes been fine then he turns into an absolute nightmare, screaming at me, head butting me, telling me to ssshhh. the neighbours heard his melt down.

so i have to hold this screaming and tantruming 2 yr old. i think about going to the car, but id have to carry him and somehow get the bike and oh yeah my back is friggin killing me and hes kicking and punching my stomach.

i did my research on this subreddit and talked to his daycare teachers, and have decided the best way to respond to this (either doing nice touch with him, or sternly telling him no, without reacting a lot to his hitting).

he switches like jackal and hyde he be all nice then bang he gets so angry for nothing most the time hes started hitting himself really hard he will smack his little head off things it takes at least 20 mins to calm him down each time its so draining most the time

she will bang her head on the wall, floor, or us. she also will hit. she is not swatted or spanked and doesnt see anyone banging their head, so i am not sure where she is getting this from. she will also scream at the top of her lungs. if you try to comfort her or settle her down it makes it worse. when she starts banging her head we pick her up so she doesnt hurt herself.
most nights he wakens and crys, we give him aroun 34 mins to see if he will settle but never has.

we were in a shop yesterday and i told him he could choose a toy but he was insistent that he wanted 2. i told him firmly that he could only have one but he dug his heels is and persisted until i carried him out of the shop screaming after hed knocked the whole display over.

i am an emotional wreck right now. my 2 year old is slapping me in the face everyday, screaming at me,  telling me no at basically anything i ask him to do. every time he hits me it breaks me even though i know it shouldnt.

problem is road has lots of potholes and ds gets distracted, wants to jump in the puddles etc, so if he starts messing i literally have to drag him off the road resulting in a tantrum on the corner of a busy junction. i have newborn ds2 in sling so find myself desperately negotiatingbribing ds1 to calm down, especially difficult when its heavy rain so more puddles and more temptation around.
fortunately she doesnt do anything like spit or hit. but she screams, throws herself to the ground, goes limp while holding my hand etc.
the only way we can get her to stop is by distracting her with the tv. but i dont feel like thats the right answer, and im worried that shes just bottling things up when we do that.

she had a paddy tonight and so i put her on the step and then eventually to bed, because she refused to go to the step so had to be manhandled there and then proceeded to shout and roar at me from the step.
my 2 year old will scream, at the top of her lungs, over and over, for the smallest reasons and she just will not stop
my son is 3 in august and i feel like the terrible twos are getting worse like he has a really bad attitude when something doesnt go his way
lots of changes have occurred lately
he was like an alligator on meth, flailing, death rolling, and screaming
sharing emotions and not hitting
i just dont know what else to do but have a cry when we get home
mine came up behind me yesterday and bit the back of my leg and when i turned around and said no she had a full meltdown. threw herself on the floor sobbing.
im starting to dread spending time with him and having a hard time dealing with it emotionally. its starting to make me cry a lot
this is accompanied by kicking, noodle arms if you try and pick her up and paralyzed legs that dont work if you try and stand her upright
i cant see any external triggerthey seem to come out of some sort of inner frustration

but im weary at the ens of eaxh day and i dread nappy changes. or asking her to take her coat off. or needing to take something from her that could cause harm. she can freak over anything and its so, so draining.
ive tried ignoring him, cuddling him, raising my voice, offering food, distracting with toystvpointing out the window and nothing works. they just keep going and he gets more distressed.

anyway, one day i went to pick her up and she didnt want to come home. grabbed her hand and dragged her out of the centre while she screamed the whole way. when i got her to the car she would not sit in her car seat  basically went stiff as a board, arms flat to her sides, legs straight out.

we can have a nice day at the park or swimming or soft play and as soon as we start to leave she starts the screaming and lying down and wont move. i dont even have the strength to lift her sometimes coz she hits out and its hard to hold while dodging the blows. this can last for about 45mins at times.

ds has had the odd occasion over the last few months of not wanting a nappy change or to put his trousers or top on but in the last week it has been every day and not just refusing but having massive tantrums
my 15 month old has awful tantrums, when he doesnt get his own way he hits me or throws toys at me and dh. i have tried to ignore this behaviour but it seems to make matters worse.

for the past month she has been waking 5,6,7 times in the night at least screaming (i want my teddy, i want water etc) and is demanding things through the day and if we dont have it she has a full blown tantrum.
ive gotten death glares from grandparents and stares from others

so my little girl is 4 years old and has explosive tantrums. the other day i asked dd (dear daughter) to clean up her toys as im trying to teach her some responsibility. she flat out said  i cant do it i said  lets not talk like that, yes you can if you try here mommy will help you by then she started throwing her toys, screaming and even flipped her mattress off her little toddler bed. i just stood there horrified watching her destructive behavior, i mean if you could call it that. i didnt know what to do other than grab her and bear hug her before she hurt herself and while she was kicking and screaming i just continued to rock her and kept telling her to calm down.
i just try and talk to him and say you have to have patience be calm, and after awhile he starts to calm down and gets it otherwise when i give him what he wants hell throw it on the floor

he has a very short temper and lashes out hitting myself and others during tantrums and has recently began screaming as loud as he can during these tantrums. how can i quickly help him to regulate these emotions and acts of frustration and anger without being angry myself
anger management

i decided last night to take a stand and treat it as naughty behaviour, so put him in the corner for 2 minute intervals. i have the most stubborn child in the world and of course it got me nowhere. after 40 minutes i needed to feed ds2 so just put ds1 in a headlock and got on with it. but it was like a physical fight and i felt awful, like i was assaulting him.
listening to her and repeating back what shes saying to show were listening  she only screams more
